intro: Ruehssia otoniensis, commonly known as the Otoni plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in the Atlantic Forest biome. It has small, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. Ruehssia otoniensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
